title: (x) Need help identifying embroidery type. - similar to Century Old Style {David C}
content:
Had this sent from someone for a redo; unfortunately this is all they have for a hard copy. Need help to ID this font. Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [el\_bosque-typ.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823072914/http:/typophile.com/files/el_bosque-typ_1.jpg) | 40.91 KB |
author: drnwrkr

comments.content:
pretty hard copy indeed..  
I hardly see anything at all

attachment did not work
Managed to finally get image to attach. Sorry about that.

It's hard to ID this font since the embroidery obliterates all the fine details.

It looks a bit like Century Old Style, maybe the embroidering machine couldn't reproduce the stroke difference in the letters?

Someone else might have a better go at this.
Yes I understand embroidery fudges fines details, but I did check out Century Old Style and it comes pretty darn close so I may just use it as an alternate and hope for the best. Thanks anyway.
